episodeTitle: Round 2! Shoot into the Groggy Ring!
description: Sanji and Zoro compete in the Groggy Ring against the Foxy Pirates' Groggy Monsters team. Despite constant bickering and facing biased refereeing and illegal weapons, they agree to cooperate for 10 seconds to turn the tide of the match.

events.title: Groggy Ring Round 2 Begins
events.description: The second round of the Davy Back Fight begins as Zoro and Sanji prepare to face the Groggy Monsters (Hamburg, Pickles, and Big Pan) in the Groggy Ring game. Sanji is chosen as the 'ball' for the Straw Hats team.
events.significance: Starts the Groggy Ring match, a pivotal event in the Davy Back Fight where the Straw Hats attempt to win back Chopper.

events.title: Biased Coin Toss
events.description: The referee conducts a rigged coin toss to determine field positions, showing clear favoritism toward the Foxy Pirates. This sets the tone for the heavily biased officiating throughout the match.
events.significance: Establishes the unfair nature of the competition and the challenges the Straw Hats must overcome.

events.title: Groggy Monsters' Illegal Tactics Begin
events.description: The Groggy Monsters begin using illegal weapons and violent tactics during the match. Hamburg uses iron gauntlets, Pickles uses spiked shoulder pads, and Big Pan uses various concealed weapons, all while the referee ignores the rule violations.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Foxy Pirates' willingness to cheat and the corrupt officiating, forcing Zoro and Sanji to fight against overwhelming odds.

events.title: Size Attack S-M-L Combination
events.description: The Groggy Monsters demonstrate their coordinated team attack 'Size Attack S-M-L': Hamburg punches the opponent with iron gauntlets, Pickles tackles them upward with spiked shoulder pads, and Big Pan slams them down with his giant palm.
events.significance: Showcases the Groggy Monsters' powerful combination attack and the teamwork they possess, in contrast to Zoro and Sanji's lack of cooperation.

events.title: Sanji Receives Yellow Card
events.description: Sanji, frustrated by the biased officiating, kicks the referee Itomimizu and receives a yellow card as punishment. This further demonstrates the unfair nature of the match where the Foxy Pirates can use weapons freely, but the Straw Hats are penalized for minor infractions.
events.significance: Highlights the corrupt nature of the Davy Back Fight and Sanji's frustration with the unjust rules.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Rivalry Hinders Performance
events.description: Throughout the match, Zoro and Sanji constantly bicker and refuse to cooperate with each other. Their rivalry and competitive nature causes them to work against each other rather than as a team, allowing the Groggy Monsters to dominate the game.
events.significance: Demonstrates the ongoing rivalry between Zoro and Sanji, and how their inability to work together puts them at a severe disadvantage against a coordinated team.

quotes.text: I don't need your help to win this!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro refusing to cooperate with Sanji during the match

events.title: Monster Burger Attack
events.description: The Groggy Monsters unveil their ultimate combination attack 'Monster Burger': Hamburg uses two clubs, Pickles uses two swords, and Big Pan uses two giant metal pans to trap and crush their opponents. This devastating attack nearly defeats Zoro and Sanji.
events.significance: The Groggy Monsters' most powerful attack, which pushes Zoro and Sanji to their limits and forces them to reconsider their approach.

events.title: Zoro Proposes 10-Second Cooperation
events.description: After being beaten severely due to their lack of teamwork, Zoro swallows his pride and proposes to Sanji that they work together for just 10 seconds to turn the tide of the match. Sanji reluctantly agrees to this temporary truce.
events.significance: A pivotal character moment showing Zoro's pragmatism and willingness to put aside his rivalry for the sake of the crew. This sets up their coordinated victory in the next episode.

quotes.text: Let's work together... just for 10 seconds.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro proposing temporary cooperation with Sanji to win the match

quotes.text: I don't need your help to win this!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Refusing to cooperate with Sanji during the match

quotes.text: Let's work together... just for 10 seconds.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Proposing temporary cooperation with Sanji to win the match

themes.description: The episode explores the importance of teamwork through Zoro and Sanji's struggle. Their rivalry and refusal to cooperate nearly costs them the match, but they eventually realize that working together, even briefly, is necessary for victory.
themes.symbolism: The Groggy Monsters' coordinated attacks represent effective teamwork, while Zoro and Sanji's individual efforts symbolize how personal conflicts can hinder collective success.

themes.description: Both Zoro and Sanji must swallow their pride to achieve their goal of rescuing Chopper. Zoro's proposal for 10-second cooperation shows maturity and pragmatism over stubborn pride.
themes.symbolism: The 10-second agreement represents a compromise between personal pride and practical necessity.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the Straw Hats' attempts to play fairly against the Foxy Pirates' blatant cheating and corrupt officiating. Despite the unfair circumstances, Zoro and Sanji refuse to stoop to their opponents' level.
themes.symbolism: The biased referee represents corruption and injustice, while Zoro and Sanji's determination represents integrity in the face of adversity.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates growth by recognizing when cooperation is necessary, even with someone he constantly rivals. His pragmatic decision to propose working together for 10 seconds shows maturity.
keyActions: Fights in the Groggy Ring match
Refuses to cooperate with Sanji initially
Takes severe beating from Groggy Monsters
quotes: I don't need your help to win this!
Let's work together... just for 10 seconds.

characterSpotlights.role: Co-protagonist and 'ball' in Groggy Ring match
characterSpotlights.development: Sanji serves as the team's 'ball' and must endure significant punishment throughout the match. His frustration with the unfair officiating leads to him kicking the referee, showing his hot-headed nature.
keyActions: Selected as the 'ball' for the Straw Hats team
Kicks the referee and receives a yellow card
Agrees to cooperate with Zoro for 10 seconds

characterSpotlights.development: Hamburg is shown as a skilled combatant who fights dirty, using iron gauntlets despite the rules forbidding weapons.
Pickles demonstrates his role as the 'Tackle Machine' with powerful ramming attacks using his spiked shoulder pads.
Big Pan showcases his hybrid wotan abilities, using his massive size and slippery fish-man skin to dominate the match.
keyActions: Uses illegal weapons including giant pans
Uses his slippery mudfish skin to evade attacks

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the Groggy Ring match across multiple episodes, while the manga covered it more briefly in chapters 310-311.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time in the series where Zoro and Sanji explicitly agree to work together, even if only for 10 seconds.
The Groggy Ring game is a rugby-like sport unique to the Davy Back Fight competition, combining elements of rugby, wrestling, and combat sports.

sources.title: Davy Back Fight - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Big Pan is a wotan, a rare hybrid of fish-man and giant, making him one of the few wotans shown in the series at this point.
The episode was written by Junki Takegami and directed by Takahiro Imamura.
